thread.title: Tourist uses travelator conveyor belts to spin his body in circles
thread.title_full: Tourist uses travelator conveyor belts to spin his body in circles | Daily Mail Online

author: Caroline Mcguire for MailOnline
title: Tourist uses travelator conveyor belts to spin his body in circles
text:
1
View
comments
Planking has been a popular internet craze for a number of years now.
But if you thought you'd seen every possible pose, think again.
In a new video called 'The best way to use a moving sidewalk', a young man makes a game out of his trip on a travelator at a Universal theme park in the US with a planking trick that leaves him in a real spin.
Anew video uploaded to YouTube called 'The best way to use a moving sidewalk', shows a young man planking on a travelator
In the video, uploaded to YouTube channel Break, his friends giggle behind the camera as he plants himself in plank form on the rubber conveyor belts traditionally used as arm rests for passengers.
As the two conveyor belts move in opposing directions, his rigid body is flipped round in circles.
 2 Next Sleeping ruff: Norwegian builder gives up bricks and mortar... British passenger banned for life from airline after... ‘Mysterious, lethal and enchanting’: TV comedian Alexander... The equal speeds from both sides mean that his position on the walkway remains the same and just his body angle is moved, creating what is called 'The sidewalk spin'.
It's a new angle to the planking craze that has dominated social media over the past few years.
As the two conveyor belts move in opposing directions, the man's rigid body is flipped round in circles
The activity follows on from the stationary planking craze that dominated social media a few years ago
The original trend saw people uploading photographs of themselves lying flat like a plank in obscure locations onto site like Facebook and Twitter.
It started in 2000 with two men called Gary Clarkson and Christian Langdon from Taunton, Somerset, who called it 'the lying down game'.
But it wasn't until 2007, when an Australian started up a Facebook page about the game that it attracted widespread attention and became 'planking.'
Read more: The best way to use a moving sidewalk! Funny Stuff! The Sidewalk Spin - YouTube
